seriesJson.title: Contemporary revolution in Latin America
seriesJson.description: A documentary series on problems facing Latin America, including panel discussions at program conclusion. The series is hosted by Erwin Canham, editor at the Christian Science Monitor.

node.title: United States and Latin America, part 2
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, explores the complicated relationship between the United States and Latin America.

node.title: United States and Latin America, part 1
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, explores the complicated relationship between the United States and Latin America.

node.title: Information barrier
node.description: This program examines if the North American press provides enough coverage of Latin American affairs and if the United States makes enough of an effort to communicate directly to Latin America.

node.title: Latin American Economy, part 2
node.description: This program, the second of two parts, focuses on Latin America's struggle for economic independence.

node.title: Latin American Economy, part 1
node.description: This program, the first of two parts, focuses on Latin America's struggle for economic independence.

node.title: Education in Latin America
node.description: This program explores the challenges facing educators in Latin America.

node.title: Cultures in conflict
node.description: This program explores the conflict between the Indian and European cultures that exist in Latin America.

node.title: Social welfare and population explosion
node.description: This program looks at the quality of life and the rapidly growing population in Latin America.

node.title: Struggle for democracy
node.description: This program discusses the challenges facing the developing democracies in Latin America.

node.title: Agrarian revolution
node.description: This program discusses issues of land and agriculture in Latin America.

node.title: Revolution of rising expectations
node.description: This program discusses "The Revolution of Rising Expectations" and how improving conditions in Latin America are spurring its citizens to demand improvements in government, education, and society in general.
